item.title: Sam and Chris Gould: Twins' suicides leads to victim policing change
item.description: Sam and Chris Gould took their own lives after a sex abuse investigation was dropped.

item.title: London riots: 'My shop was burned down but we came back stronger'
item.description: Trevor Reeves and Bushra Ahmed both lost businesses during a night of violence in August 2011.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces backlash over Thatcher coal mines comment
item.description: The PM said closing "so many" coal mines gave the UK an "early start" in climate fight.

item.title: Pride in London parade cancelled for second year
item.description: The UK's biggest LGBT pride festival usually takes place every summer in the capital.

item.title: Afghan war: I can still hear my cry, says mother of dead soldier
item.description: As fighting in Afghanistan rages, the BBC speaks to the mother of a British soldier who died there nearly 10 years ago.

item.title: Kaylee-Jayde Priest: Mother and boyfriend convicted of manslaughter
item.description: Kaylee-Jayde Priest's grandmother said she was "stolen from me in the most brutal of ways".

item.title: Bournemouth beach closed after 'large animal' spotted in sea
item.description: Visitors say there was a shark sighting, though lifeguards were unable to identify the animal.

item.title: Dea-John Reid: Five people deny murdering boy, 14
item.description: Two men and three teenagers plead not guilty over the death of Dea-John Reid.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Max Whitlock gets hero's welcome at gym club
item.description: The gold medallist performed backflips for cheering crowds on his return from Tokyo.

item.title: Weston shanty festival benefits from Covid call-off
item.description: Due to be held in 2020, the Weston Shanty Festival hopes to ride the wave of interest in the genre.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland and the UK
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: 'I proved them wrong'
item.description: John Noble's recovery from an accident which left him with severe injuries has been described as a "miracle".

item.title: Nottingham phone thieves distracted victims by dancing
item.description: Police say the men pretended to be drunk to distract their student victims.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Wolverhampton proud of Ben Whittaker
item.description: Friends and family in Wolverhampton couldn't be prouder of the silver medallist.

item.title: Covid: Wigan nurse's photos capture life in intensive care unit
item.description: Nurse Petro Bekker's photos of her team in the intensive care unit are to feature in an exhibition.

item.title: Wigan family rescue deer from drowning in canal
item.description: Chris and Denver Kendall, from Wigan, tied two dog leads together to pull the animal to safety.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Laura Kenny sets record as she and Katie Archibald win madison gold
item.description: Laura Kenny becomes the first British woman to win gold at three Olympics as she and Katie Archibald are crowned madison champions.

item.title: Jack Grealish: 'If he had stayed at Villa he would be immortal' - but where does he fit in at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport takes a closer look at what Jack Grealish will bring to Manchester City after signing from Aston Villa for Â£100m.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain beat India to win women's hockey bronze
item.description: Great Britain claim bronze in the women's hockey at Tokyo 2020 with a thrilling 4-3 victory against India.

item.title: Eight things to look out for as the EFL returns
item.description: With the EFL season starting on Friday, BBC Sport looks at eight things to watch for - from returning fans to veteran managers.
